instruction: Create a Blueprint with a string array MenuItems. On BeginPlay, loop through MenuItems and print each item name. After loop, create WBP_Menu and add to viewport.
output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_DynamicMenu
PARENT: Actor
VAR MenuItems: Array<String>
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=MenuItems]
NODE n3: ForEachLoop
NODE n4: PrintString
NODE n5: CreateWidget [WidgetClass=WBP_Menu]
NODE n6: AddToViewport
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.Array [Array]
EXEC n3.LoopBody -> n4.Execute
DATA n3.ArrayElement -> n4.InString [String]
EXEC n3.Completed -> n5.Execute
EXEC n5.Then -> n6.Execute
DATA n5.ReturnValue -> n6.Target [Widget]

instruction: Create a Blueprint that on BeginPlay creates WBP_Dialog and adds to viewport. On pressing Confirm, remove the dialog and print Confirmed.
output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_Dialog
PARENT: Actor
VAR Dialog: Widget = None
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: CreateWidget [WidgetClass=WBP_Dialog]
NODE n3: AddToViewport
NODE n4: VariableSet [VarName=Dialog]
NODE n5: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Confirm"]
NODE n6: VariableGet [VarName=Dialog]
NODE n7: RemoveFromParent
NODE n8: PrintString [InString="Confirmed"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.Target [Widget]
EXEC n3.Then -> n4.Execute
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n4.Value [Widget]
EXEC n5.Pressed -> n7.Execute
DATA n6.Value -> n7.Target [Widget]
EXEC n7.Then -> n8.Execute

instruction: Create a Blueprint where pressing Next uses MultiGate with 3 outputs. Each output creates a different widget: WBP_Page1, WBP_Page2, WBP_Page3 and adds to viewport.
output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_PagedUI
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Next"]
NODE n2: MultiGate
NODE n3: CreateWidget [WidgetClass=WBP_Page1]
NODE n4: AddToViewport
NODE n5: CreateWidget [WidgetClass=WBP_Page2]
NODE n6: AddToViewport
NODE n7: CreateWidget [WidgetClass=WBP_Page3]
NODE n8: AddToViewport
EXEC n1.Pressed -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.Out_0 -> n3.Execute
EXEC n3.Then -> n4.Execute
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.Target [Widget]
EXEC n2.Out_1 -> n5.Execute
EXEC n5.Then -> n6.Execute
DATA n5.ReturnValue -> n6.Target [Widget]
EXEC n2.Out_2 -> n7.Execute
EXEC n7.Then -> n8.Execute
DATA n7.ReturnValue -> n8.Target [Widget]

instruction: Create a Blueprint that on BeginPlay creates WBP_Loading and adds to viewport. After 3 seconds, remove loading widget, create WBP_MainMenu, and add to viewport. Print Ready.
output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_LoadingFlow
PARENT: Actor
VAR LoadingWidget: Widget = None
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: CreateWidget [WidgetClass=WBP_Loading]
NODE n3: AddToViewport
NODE n4: VariableSet [VarName=LoadingWidget]
NODE n5: Delay [Duration=3.0]
NODE n6: VariableGet [VarName=LoadingWidget]
NODE n7: RemoveFromParent
NODE n8: CreateWidget [WidgetClass=WBP_MainMenu]
NODE n9: AddToViewport
NODE n10: PrintString [InString="Ready"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.Target [Widget]
EXEC n3.Then -> n4.Execute
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n4.Value [Widget]
EXEC n4.Then -> n5.Execute
EXEC n5.Completed -> n7.Execute
DATA n6.Value -> n7.Target [Widget]
EXEC n7.Then -> n8.Execute
EXEC n8.Then -> n9.Execute
DATA n8.ReturnValue -> n9.Target [Widget]
EXEC n9.Then -> n10.Execute
